name: Heian Yondan
hiraganaName: へいあん よんだん
description: Heian Yondan is the fourth kata in the Heian series with 27 movements and kiai on movements 13 and 25. The kata begins like Heian Nidan, but the movement is slow, and the blocks are performed with open hands (kaishu haiwan-uke). It also includes a downward block with both hands (gedan juji uke), elbow strike straight forward (mae-empi-uchi), wedge block (kakiwake-uke), and knee strike (hiza-uchi). It takes approximately 50 seconds to perform the kata.
